tspan.tspan: systems take the form of hermitian
hermitian operator O is an operator such
that for any state S we have that
(OS)† = S† ￮ O, where † is the dual
operater.) In particular, one is generally
interested in the "expectation value" of an
observable which is given by (S† ￮ O)(S).
The imporant part is that observables
can generally be expressed as a finite
state transducer, which means that the
computed and takes the form of an
